chargeHist.descr: OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • LaVerne C Mancl was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

timeConds.notes: Court grants work release and good time. Credit for 3 days served to be applied towards conditional jail time.

Defendant LaVerne C Mancl in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates Joint Agreement.  State moves to amend Count 1 to OWI 5th without minor enhancer.  PSI is waived by all parties. BAC - .160.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.
Court grants Count 1 amended to OWI 5th without minor enhancer.
Court questions Defendant.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as amended.
Court accepts and finds Guilty to Count 1 as amended.
Court orders Count 2, Count 3 and any companion citations - dismissed. 

Court orders PSI.
Attorney Raymond relates and requests waiver of PSI.
Court rescinds order for PSI and proceeds to sentencing.
State relates recommendation.
Attorney Raymond relates recommendation.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders: Sentence Withheld.
Probation: 3 years.
Jail: 12 months with work release and good time credit.  Credit for 3 days served to be applied to conditional jail time.
$600.00 Fine and Court Costs. 
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Driver's License Revocation - 36 months.
Ignition Interlock Device - 36 months.  
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Felony admonitions given including firearm prohibition and voter's rights.
Defendant remanded into custody.

Count 3

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license or permit.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
When in Barron County must submit to daily PBTs at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 PM.  When out-of-county does not have to take PBT.
Must abide by a curfew of 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM daily at his residence.

06/25/2014 this bond is amended as follows:

Daily PBT  requirements are eliminated
Curfew requirement is eliminated.

ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.
